message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.GR, cs.CC, cs.SC. 

The paper deals with a geometric structure induced by a convex polygon and studies computational problems related to it. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the Computational Geometry (cs.CG) sub-category. The paper also discusses location queries and optimization problems, which are typical topics in Data Structures (cs.DS) and Optimization and Control (cs.GR) sub-categories, respectively. Additionally, the paper mentions the parallelism of line segments, which is a topic in Concurrent, Distributed, and Parallel Computing (cs.CC) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the interaction between the structure and the boundary of the polygon, which is a topic in Symbolic Computation (cs.SC) sub-category.
